author: Lalitha Ranjani
text:
Demonstration and display of Nendo No Tetsukuri, Judo demonstration and dance recital by Japanese Indian classical dancers marked day one of Japan Cultural Festival, jointly organised by the Consulate-General of Japan in Chennai and ABK-AOTS Dosokai, Tamilnadu Centre.

The three-day festival, which is open to all, was inaugurated by Junichi Fukao, Researcher/Advisor — Culture and Information Affairs, Consulate-General of Japan in Chennai. As part of the festival, there was an exhibition of Japanese dolls, ikebana, origami and Nendo clay at ABK-AOTS Dosokai.

The day also saw ‘A Night of Jasmine’— a dance performance by Japanese Indian classical dancers. The event had ace danseuse Dr. Padma Subrahmanyam as chief guest and was presided over by Seiji Baba, Consul-General of Japan.

Demonstration of Origami and Kobudo are scheduled to take place on Saturday. The festival will conclude on Sunday with a Mini Marathon Run from labour statue in Marina at 6.30 a.m.
title: Japan cultural fest in city
